4.2. External CSS¶

  1. In previous chapter we saw the usage of inline styles.
  2. As the code grows it becomes difficult to manage both HTML and CSS in single document.
  3. Hence a smarter way to work is to write the CSS in another sheet and embed link that sheet in the HTML document.
  4. To do this, their is a <link> tag in HTML which helps to link the external style sheet to be used in the HTML document for formatting.

4.2.1. Syntax¶

<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="url">

  1. URL in the above syntax is the location where the .css file is located.
  2. Similarly we can embed the javascripts as well in the HTML document.
